@happiestoutdoor @outdoorvan I haven't been out there since they put in the suspension bridge
A couple of good multi-day hikes loaded with waterfalls are Berg Lake and Iceline/Whaleback (both in BC too!) #bchikechat
A6: pick a cloudy day and use a tripod. Polarizer also good for cutting reflections and acts as neutral density filter too #bchikechat
@happiestoutdoor @FATFEastVan sure why not - and have a live in-person chat as we go :-) #bchikechat
@happiestoutdoor @vancouvertrails I want to go back and do that hike on a dry day...! #bchikechat
A5: so tough to answer... Niagara is impressive, Helmcken, Emperor, Takakkaw, Yosemite (inc Vernal & Nevada Falls), all of Kauai #bchikechat
@FATFEastVan maybe this winter sometime - I plan to do the East & West Canyon circuit now the new bridge is in place #bchikechat
A4: I was going to say Della Falls, but then I remembered Calvin Falls on Nootka https://t.co/CjtkAhJ6VK #bchikechat
@happiestoutdoor do it :-) It's spectacular but save it for good weather. The camp spot on Panorama Ridge is one of my faves #bchikechat
@FATFEastVan haven't explored the upper falls yet - my impression is that it's a bit dicey if wet #bchikechat
@outdoorvan Ooh, now that's still on my list... maybe sometime this winter? #bchikechat
@happiestoutdoor there's a side trail off the West Canyon trail heading up towards Golden Ears https://t.co/HmsZI7ftMu #bchikechat
A3: I'm partial to the falls and cascades on Brothers Creek, but Twin Falls in Lynn Canyon is a close second #bchikechat
@TourismBCNorth definitely on my list! #bchikechat
A2: Gold Creek - I think the best view is from the opposite bank. The falls on Eaton Creek are impressive too #bchikechat
@happiestoutdoor it is definitely a little trickier to get a good view but you can hear them for most of the hike #bchikechat
A1: probably High Falls Creek but Crooked Falls is a close second #bchikechat
Evening all, Andy here in Vancouver #bchikechat
